item.title: A Basic Causal Analysis
item.description: Causal inference is a set of methods used to predict what will happen to an outcome when we change an input variable. In this post we will use it to solve a simple problem. By following along you’ll gain intuition into why the correlation between two variables can be poor estimates of the causal effect. I’ll also introduce you to basic causal inference methods. I’ve stripped back the complexity to make the the core features of a causal analysis obvious, but in the real world causal inference is usually much more involved.
